intro: Peucedanum olifantianum, commonly known as the giant cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in compound umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
